CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, pg. 5, reads: "Public Affairs Are His Affair - Wendell L. Wray heads the public affairs division of Carnegie Library. He keeps abreast of the times by reading current newspapers and literature, studying contemporary foreign-language novels, and by public speaking and TV appearances.  He is a magna cum laude graduate of Bates College in Maine. - Harris Photo."Some of the books are: "National Security and Individual Freedom" by Harold D. Lasswell, "Understanding Politics: A Practical Guide for Women" by Louise M. Young, and "Farmer in a Business Suit" by John Davis.  There is also a copy of of the New York Herald Tribune newspaper, lying on the bottom shelf, with the headline "America's Network of Defense Pack Allies."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of librarian Wendell Wray, posed behind large globe, in Carnegie Library of Pittsburgh
